conclusion: To find the time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary AB in the transparent body ABDE with a refractive index n = √2.
The speed of light in a medium is given by v = c/n, where c is the speed of light in a vacuum and n is the refractive index of the medium.
The light travels from point O to the boundary AB at an angle of 45°.
The time t taken for light to travel a distance d at speed v is given by t = d/v.
The time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary AB is t = d / 2.12 × 10^8 seconds.
